comment: Prof. Ferrani does not upload grades EVER. Even if you ask, he'll give you a vague answer. If you take his class be aware that you're rolling the dice on what your final grade will be. No clear grading Rubric, no extra credit, no information on the weight of assignments. He's nice and a good teacher, but like I said you're gambling with your grade

Prof. Ferrani is a nice guy but a terrible teacher. The "flipped" classroom (study at home, practice in class) is counterintuitive, and students were lost all semester. What drove me nuts was that he didn't give any sort of rubric or instructions for major assignments. He just says, "Make a powerpoint." You don't know how you are being graded!

Prof. Ferrani is the BEST! He is so nice & caring. He teaches the material well & will not move on until everyone gets it! He is very lenient & understanding! Exams were pretty easy. Make sure to practice a lot. Definitely take Ferrani if you have the opportunity you won't regret it! I'm gonna miss being in his class! Easy A!

I took Prof Ferrani for French 1001 & 1002, and I loved him both semesters. Languages don't come naturally to me, but he made me love learning French. The textbook is mandatory because you need the online access code. A lot of homework, but not due till the day of the test. Grades tests pretty easily. He's overall a great teacher and kind man.

Prof Ferrani is probably the kindest professor I've ever had. He truly wants all of his students to learn and appreciate French. Attendence is mandatory, and he gives a participation grade. There's 4 tests, all of which he graded pretty leniently. He assigns a bunch of online homework, but it's not due till the day of the test. Would take again!

Prof. Ferrani is an amazing professor. He does give a "study guide" before each test which is very useful. He gives a load of homework signed online at the beginning of each unit and you have till the night after the test to finish it. There is a final with an oral test. Participation is also key. If you do the homework and listen you'll do well.

M. Ferrani is a very sweet, patient, and helpful teacher. Even though most of the class was in French, he repeated himself and used a lot of gestures so we could understand what he was talking about. You will need the book so you can access the website to do your homework, but other than that, you can follow the lectures. Will definitely take again

As someone who is not gifted in foreign language at all, I did very well in this class. I learned more in one semester in Professor Ferrani's class than I've learned in my previous three semesters. He's super friendly and genuinely want you to do well. His teaching style is very easy to follow and informative

I really only enrolled in this class because it was the only available one that remotely interested me. After taking Ferrani, I would take the next level French class if he was teach. He is very helpful and nice. The workload is not too heavy at all, but it can be challenging. Class almost always ends early. One of the best professors I've taken!
Great Professor! Very helpful and understanding. Loves to make the class interesting and enjoyable. Highly recommended.
Wonderful professor! I definitely recommend him! He is more than willing to help anyone, and is patient!
Great professor!! Do not take French with anyone else. Always helpful and in good spirits.
A really nice professor who helped as much as he could.  Recommend.

A really wonderful prof. He's laid back and fun but we still learned a lot. He's patient and willing to work with students to help them as much as they need. I took him for 2001 and 2001, as most people end up doing. Really a great teach and person! Must take if taking French

Great teacher, really cares about his students.  Lovely personality and he knows what he is talking about.  The tests, quizzes were not too clear but that is the fault from the department not his, the dept writes syllabi for every body and he cannot change it so he is stuck because of a control freak in charge of the french department.
Great teacher! He's probably my favorite professor at KSU so far. He's very helpful and he cares about his students. I definitely recommend him!
He is a wonderful professor. Always up and possitive. Learning is easy and he makes the class interesting. You should take him. You will learn and have fun

Wonderful teacher. If you need help, he is usually there well before class begins, and is always willing to help. Quizzes and tests are very easy as long as you pay attention in class - there are no surprises. Some assignments are a little vague, however if you ask him about it, he is more than happy to clarify.

Frustrating and confusing. We rarely use the book or a standard vocab set. As a result, we're constantly trying to learn new grammatical structures using unfamiliar language. Even the quizzes are full of words - and sometimes even structures - we've never seen. And don't bother trying to talk to him after class. He just gets glassy-eyed and bolts.
He makes French easy.  When he uses unfamiliar vocabulary, he makes his meaning apparent with facial expressions and body language. However, sometimes class assignments and requirements are unclear.
